doc.field: MS. IN THE LIBRARY OF TRINITY COLLEGE, CAMBRIDGE. The Feate of Gardeninge. Ho so wyl a gardener be Here he may both hyre & se Euery tyme of the ?ere & of the mone And how the crafte schall be done Yn what maner he schall delue & sette Bothe yn drowthe and yn wette How he schall hys sedys sowe Of euery moneth he most knowe Bothe of wortys and of leke Ownyns and of garleke Percely clarey and eke sage And all other herbage. Off Settyng' and Reryng' of Treys. Yn the calenders of Ianuar' Thu sclatt treys both set & rere To graffy ther yn appyl & pere And what treys ys kynd hem to bere Appul and A appul-tre For ther ys kynd ys most to be Of pere y mynde ?orne To graffe hym a-poÃ± a haw-thorne. Of Graffyng' of Treys. Thu my?t graffe appul & pere Fro the moneth of septembr' to auerer Wyth a saw thou schalt the tre kytte And w? a knyfe smowth make hytte Klene A-tweyne the stok of the tre Where-yn that thy graffe schall be Make thy Kyttyng' of thy graffe By-twyne the newe & the olde staffe So that hit be made to lyfe As the bake & the egge of a knyfe A wegge thu sette yn myddys the tre That euery syde fro other fle Tyl hit be openyd wyde Where yn the graffe schal be leyde The rynde of Ã¾? graffe & Ã¾? tre Most a-corde how that his ever be Al-so sone Ã¾? graffe a-cordyth w? the stok Take the wegge A-none vp Upon the stok all A-bowte Clay mote be leyde to kepe Ã¾? rayne owte For the schowrys of the rayne Upon Ã¾? clay thu schalt mese layne Wyth a wyth of haseltre rynde The stoke fast thu bynde But thu do thys y vnderstonde Al thy graffe wul turne apon thy honde Yf he be graffyd at raysowne He wul bere Ã¾? next saysowne. Of Cuttyng' and Settyng' of Vynys. Of settyng' of vynys we most have yn mynde How thay schal be sette al yn here kynde Whyle hit ys esterne wynde Thu schalt kytte noÃ¾er sette no bynde When the wynde ys yn the west To kutte & to sette ys al-ther best Yn thys maner Ã¾? schalt kytte Ã¾? vyne-tre To be sette hit schal have knottys Ã¾re Too schal be sette yn the grownde And one A-boue for growynde Yn Ã¾? lond where h? schal growen ynne Hit wold aske to be dy?te w? dynge Every ?ere w? ou?t-drede Ãey wold aske dyng' A-bou?t ham sprede Grow they wul sone and long' be Than put vnder ham forkys of tre Of thys tale lete us now stone And to A-nother we wul gone. Of Settyng' and Sowyng' of Sedys. Yn the day of Seynt Valentyne Thu schalt sowe this sedys yn tyme For they beÃ¾ herbys vn-meke Ã? schalt ham set & sow eke They Ã¾? beÃ¾ stronge and nou?t meke The names of hem ys garlek & leke Oynet Ã¾? schalt sow then Other Ã¾er after sone A-pon To set oynyns to make the sede Y wul the tel for my mede Yn auerell oÃ¾er yn mars as y haue y-fownde To set other to sowe hem yn the grownde When they bygynnyth to grow hye Lete none of ham towche other' nye Vnder hem than put Ã¾? schall That none of hem downe nou?t fall Yf Ã¾? wyl that hy the Forkys y made of asche-tre To haue ham saue & kepe hare prow They wolde aske askys a-bowt ham y-strow When they rype they wyl schow And by the bollys Ã¾? schalt hem know The sede w?-yn wul schewe blake Then Ã¾? schalt hem vp take They wul be rype at the full At lammasse of peter Apostull On thys maner Ã¾? schalt Ã¾? sedys drye Vppon a clothe Ã¾? the sedys lye A-?en the sonne his kynd ys For to ly to dry y-wys Here of y can no more say But now y wul bygynne a new lay. Of Sowyng' and Settyng' of Wurtys. Wurtys we most haue Both to mayster & to knaue Ye schul haue mynde here To have wurtys yong' al tyme of Ã¾? yere Euery moneth hath his name To set & sow w?-ou?t eny blame May for somer ys al the best July for eruyst ys the nexst Novembr' for wynter mote the thyrde be Mars for lent so mote y the The lond mote wel y dygnyd be Y-dolue y-sturyd syre parde Whan Ã¾? hast y-sow thi sede on long' Foore wykys ther' aftur Ã¾? let hem stonde Whan Ã¾? iiij wykes beth al ouer gone Take thy plontys euery-chone And set ham yn kynd fat lond And thay wul fayre wurtys be & long W?yn too wykes Ã¾? thay beth y-sett Thu may pul hem to thy mete And so fro moneth to monethe Ã? schalt bryng' thy wurtys forthe They Ã¾? schal bere sede lasse & more Let ham grow to make the store Of wurtys can y no more telle Of other herbys her'after y schelle. Of the Kynde of Perselye. Further ouerpasse y nell Tyl y haue tolde Ã¾? kynde of percell Percell kynde ys for to be To be sow yn Ã¾? monthe of mars so mote y the He wul grow long' and thykke And euer as he growyth Ã¾? schalt hym kytte Ã? may hym kytte by reson' Ãryes yn one seson' Wurtys to make & sewes also Let hym neuer to hye go To lete hym grow to hye hit ys grete foly For he wul then blest and wanchy Hys kynde ys nou?t to be sette To be sow ys al-ther' best Thay Ã¾? the sede schal bere the Kytte hym nou?t but lete hym be Fro mydwynter to the natyuyte And he schal fayre sede be Of percell ys ly?t to know Take hede he wul nou?t be set but sow For yf he be set be wul wax thynne And than he wul nou?t be gode to rypyne Now here-of lete we be And to a-nother' we wul te Of other maner Herbys. Of other' herbys y schall telle Ãerfor' y mote A stownd dwell Yn what moneth ys hervest ham sette & sow Sone here-after Ã¾? schalt knowe Yn the moneth of Auerell Set & sow ham euerydell Herbys to make bothe sawce & sewe Ã? schalt haue ham here A rewe Of al the herbys of yrlonde Here Ã¾? schalt knowe meny onde Pelyter dytawnder rewe & sage Clarey tyme ysope and orage Myntys sauerey tuncarse & spynage Letows calamynte auans & borage Fynel sowthrynwode warmot & rybwort Herbe Ion herbe Robert herbe Water & walwort Hertystonge polypody parrow & comfery Gromel woderofe hyndesall & betony Gladyn valeryan scabyas & sperewort Verueyn wodesour' waterlyly & lyuerworte Mouseer' egri moyne honysoke & bugull Centory horsel adderstong' & bygull Henbane camemyl wyldtesyl & stychewort Weybrede growdyswyly elysauwder & brysewort Merege lauyndull radysche sanycle & seueny Peruynke violet cowslyppe and lyly Carsyndyllys strowberys and moderwort Langebefe totesayne tansay & feldewort Orpy nepte horehownd & flos campi Affodyll redeuay primrole & oculus Christi Rose ryde rose why?te foxgloue & pympernold Holyhocke coryawnder pyony & Ã¾? wold All this herbys by seynt Mychaell Wold be sette yn the moneth of Auerell Further'-more wul y no?t go But here of herbys wul y ho. Of the Kynde of Saferowne. Of saferowne we mote telle He schal be kepte fayre & welle Saferowne wul haue w?ou?t lesyng' Beddys y-made wel wyth dyng' For sothe yf thay schal bere Ãay wold be sette yn Ã¾? moneth of September Three days by-fore seynt mary day natyuyte Other the next woke Ã¾erafter so mote y the W? a dybbyl Ã¾? schalt ham sette That Ã¾? dybbyl by-fore be blunt & grete Three ynchys depe they most sette be And thus seyde mayster Ion Gardener to me. Explicit hic liber qui vocatur Anglice Mayster Ion Gardener.
